page.title: 03The Valley
page.content: The valley was made by the River Kensey.The river is small and therefore not navigable. Also in the valley there is the Launceston Steam Railway which follows the track of the former Southern Railway. The line used to run as far as Padstow and carried the Atlantic Coast Express.The train which takes you on your ride runs just inside our area.The tracks run as far as the bridge along Underlane.It is hoped that the restored railway will run as far as Newmills.Along Underlane is a breakers yard.At the height of summer Underlane is only seven feet wide because of the hedge growth. Fortunately there are regular passing places.South of Athill Farm is a ford of the Kensey, now used only by large lorries and tractors.
